acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.00012mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the mouse LD50 (dermal roue) value of 296mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1973)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 1.75mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1994)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a liquid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 136mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1973)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related evidence of tumor incidence observed in 18-month carcinogenicity studies in mice, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1997).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=5.14 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data.

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on in vivo reverse mutation tests in vitro (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1977)), in vitro chromosome aberration tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)) and in vivo micronucleus tests on mouse bone marrow cells (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2004)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) bound to the elements other than carbon and hydrogen

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of treatment-related effects on reproduction and offspring development in rat 3-generation reproduction studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1975)) and rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1974, 1988)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (test temperature: 140degC).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1974)): At 24 hours, treated animals exhibited chemosis in unwashed eyes, but the reactions cleared up by 72 hours.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests: "Caused mild irritation which was fully reversible by Day 5" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1974)).

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the evidence of mild sensitization observed in guinea pig skin sensitization studies using the Maximization method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2004)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (water solubility: 0.853mg/L (20degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data))

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In rat subacute toxicity studies, decreases in plasma/red blood cell/brain cholinesterase levels were found at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1 (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1956)). However, classification is not possible since no evidence of other common symptoms and pathological findings was reported.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In rat single dose toxicity studies, clinical signs and symptoms including shivering, salivation, lacrimation, tachypnea, diarrhea, tremors, staggering gait, hypofunction, excessive chewing, writhing, hyporeflexia, short of breath and coma were reported (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1973)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.
